about_the_game:
Created by programming students at the Academy of Art University on our free time, Project Rogue is a roguelite, first-person dungeon crawler inspired by classic RPGs with a modern touch. Explore the endless dungeon as you kill monsters, level up, and collect loot. The dungeon is procedurally generated so it will always be a different experience. Find magic items to improve your character so that you can survive boss fights in deeper levels. The class you select determines your starting equipment, and then you choose how your character progresses. Will you play a hardened fighter wielding two-handed weapons? Or perhaps a spell caster that overwhelms enemies with magic? You are in control.

Features

  • Procedural content generation
  • Old school RPG vibe
  • Stat-based progression
  • Character customization
  • Endless replayability

content_descriptors.notes: Goblins, skeletons, ghosts, and other monsters carry weapons to attack the player with. There is a blood spatter effect on the screen when the player attacks with their weapon. Weapons can drop, be found in chests, or be purchased in town.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer
  • Processor: 4 Cores / 2.5 GHz+
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 620 / NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1050 Ti / RTX 580
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer
  • Processor: 4 Cores / 3.5 GHz+
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD Graphics 630 NVidia GeForce GTX 1080 / RX 5700 XT
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

short_description: Explore the endlessly generated dungeon as you kill monsters, level up, and collect loot in this first-person dungeon crawler. Magic items improve your character's stats so that it's easier to use better equipment and learn better spells. You choose how your character progresses.
